thread.title: Make room, the divas are here.
thread.title_full: Make room, the divas are here. - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost.com
title: Make room, the divas are here.
text:
Divas Ariana Grande, Shania twain and Nicki Minaj are each performing in the D.C. area this week. (John Jay Cabuay) July 17 at 1:10 PM There is no “i” in pop star, but there certainly is one in diva — and in the names of the three women who are headlining big concerts here this week, Ariana Grande, Shania Twain and Nicki Minaj. The hail from different musical genres, representing different decades and three different nations. One had huge sales, but the others boast a much larger presence on social media. (In the 21st century, which is more important?) All are represented by their own scents, and each has spent time as a reality-show judge. All are diminutive. Two have even worked together, with Grande and Minaj teaming up on the hit “Bang Bang” with Jessie J. Let’s further compare the three as the big shows approach:
Ariana Shania Nicki Real name Ariana Grande-Butera Eilleen Regina Edwards Onika Tanya Maraj Birthplace Boca Raton, Fla. Windsor, Ontario Trinidad and Tobago Age 22 49 32 Height 5’0” 5’4” 5’2” Music genre Pop Country pop Hip-hop, R&B Big break Cast on “Victorious” Meets Mutt Lange Discovered by Lil’ Wayne Was opening act for Justin Bieber, 2013 Toby Keith, 1993 Britney Spears, 2011 Biggest hit “Problem” featuring Iggy Azalea “You’re Still the One” “Anaconda” Feminist anthem “Break Free” “Man! I Feel Like a Woman!” “Get on Your Knees” American Music Awards won 1 5 4 Perfume Ari, coming this fall Shania, a floral woody musk Minajesty, her third Fanclub nickname Arianators Shaniafans Barbies Reality judge Guest on “RuPaul’s Drag Race” “American Idol” guest judge “American Idol,” all of season 12 Recent apology Video of her licking doughnuts and saying “I hate America” Venue problems and lines at Ottawa show Using Nazi imagery in “Only” video Number of albums 2 4 3 U.S. album sales 560,000 44 million 4 million Twitter followers 30.6 million 542,000 19.6 million Instagram followers 37.9 million 180,000 28.6 million Latest album “My Everything” “Still the One: Live from Vegas” “The Pinkprint” Current tour “The Honeymoon Tour” “Rock This Country” “The Pinkprint Tour” Number of dates on tour 84 67 49 Local stop Verizon Center, Saturday Verizon Center, Tuesday Jiffy Lube Live, Wednesday Opening act Prince Royce Gavin DeGraw Meek Mill Ticket price range $29.50 to $79.50 $50.50 to $151 $25 to $175 Shania Twain plays the Verizon Center, 601 F St. NW, Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Ariana Grande plays there Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Call 202-397-7328 or visit verizoncenter.monumentalnetwork.com .
Nicki Minaj plays Jiffy Lube Live, 7800 Cellar Door Dr., Bristow, Va., Wednesday at 7 p.m. in a show that also features Rae Sremmurd, Tinashe and Dej Loaf. Call 703-754-6400 or visit www.livenation.com .
Catlin is a freelance writer.
